questions.text: What is the nickname of the club?
questions.explanation:
The Bairns.

	The nickname derives from the town motto, "It is better to meddle with the devil, than to meddle with the Bairns of Falkirk".

questions.text: When was the Falkirk club formed?
questions.explanation:
1876.

	The club was formed in 1876 with their kit of white pants, blue and white horizontally striped shirts, and blue and white horizontally striped socks.  They were elected to Scottish Division Two 1902.

questions.text: Which player made four "debuts" for the club?
questions.explanation:
Kevin McAllister.

	Kevin McAllister was signed from the Camelon Juniors, then came back on loan from Chelsea, signed from Chelsea, and then was sold to Hibernian.  He then signed back from Hibernian.

questions.text: When in the 20th century did Falkirk win their final Scottish FA Cup?
questions.explanation:
1957.

	Falkirk won the Scottish Cup in 1957 by beating Kilmarnock after a replay.

questions.text: In which year did Falkirk win the First Division, but did not get promoted?
questions.explanation:
2003.

	They failed to get promoted due to not having the 10,000 seats required by the SPL.  After that, the SPL lowered the requirements to 6000 seats.

questions.text: In September 1893, Falkirk set a club record with a blowout victory.  What was the score?
questions.explanation:
12-1.

	On September 23, 1893, Falkirk beat Laurieston 12-1 in the Scottish Cup.

questions.text: In 2010, Falkirk was involved in two 10-goal thrillers in the space of seven days. They won 6-4, and then the week after they lost 6-4. Who were their opponents?
questions.explanation:
Forfar Athletic and Hamilton Academicals.

	In an incredible week, Falkirk beat Forfar 6-4, then the following week they lost 6-4 to Hamilton.

Dunfermline Athletic.

	No one can explain why Dunfermline and Falkirk hate each other.  Some supporters point a finger at an incident at 1913 Scottish Cup final, but nobody can substantiate anything.

questions.text: Who did Falkirk defeat in the Scottish League Cup on August 31, 1994?
questions.explanation:
Rangers.

	Falkirk won 2-1 at Ibrox Stadium, thanks to two Richard Cadette goals.

questions.text: Which former England International played four games for the club in September 1997?
questions.explanation:
Chris Waddle.

	Chris Waddle played four times for the club while scoring one goal vs. Clydebank.
